metadata.name: ragflow
metadata.description: RAGFlow is an open-source RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) engine based on deep document understanding.

issues.title: [Question]: the process
issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( 非英文标题的提交将会被直接关闭 ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

@dosu After the user enters the question, how does the system process the question and generate the answer?

comments_data.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The system processes a user's question and generates an answer through a series of components in a defined workflow:

1. **Begin Component**: Initiates the interaction with a prologue message.
2. **Answer Component**: Prepares the question for further processing.
3. **KeywordExtract Component**: Analyzes the question to extract important keywords or phrases using a language model with specific parameters.
4. **Wikipedia Component**: Uses the extracted keywords to retrieve relevant information from Wikipedia, fetching the top 10 relevant entries.
5. **Generate Component**: Processes the question and retrieved information to generate a response. It uses a language model configured with parameters like `temperature` to control the response generation.
6. **Switch Component**: Evaluates the generated response and determines the next step based on predefined conditions.
7. **Message Components**: Outputs a specific message based on the routing from the "Switch" component.

This structured flow ensures efficient processing, retrieval, and response generation based on the user's question <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/test/dsl_examples/baidu_generate_and_switch.json)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/canvas.py)</sup><sup>[[3]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/component/generate.py)</sup><sup>[[4]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/test/dsl_examples/keyword_wikipedia_and_generate.json)</sup>.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

performed_via_github_app.name: DosuBot
performed_via_github_app.description:
## Dosu

Dosu is an AI-powered Github maintainer agent. Dosu helps open source maintainers encourage contributors, organize issues, triage bugs, answer questions, and more. 

### 🤩 Community Reactions

- ["The bot is right!"](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/issues/7684#issuecomment-1721430612)
- ["Yes, that was the problem, I can confirm it works fine now!"](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13115#issuecomment-1803510213)
- [“Thanks jinja2 worked perfectly.”](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13055#issuecomment-1801778473)
- ["Thank you, you have been very helpful."](https://github.com/astronomer/astronomer-cosmos/issues/670#issuecomment-1809333870)

comments_data.body: @dosu 是将用户的问题分析为向量和关键词，与向量数据库中的信息查询吗，关键词是怎么获得的呢？与什么查询呢？

<!-- Answer -->
关键词是通过`KeywordExtract`组件从用户的问题中提取的。该组件使用语言模型分析问题，并识别出最重要的关键词或短语。具体过程如下：

1. **初始化**：`KeywordExtractParam`类被初始化，其中包括`top_n`参数，指定要提取的关键词数量。在示例中，`top_n`设置为1，即只提取最重要的一个关键词或短语。

2. **提示生成**：`get_prompt`方法构建一个提示，指示语言模型总结用户的问题并提取前`top_n`个关键词或短语，关键词之间用逗号分隔。提示中指定模型的角色为问题分析器，并包含总结问题的要求。

3. **执行**：`_run`方法获取用户的查询，格式化后通过`LLMBundle`类发送给语言模型。模型处理提示并返回关键词。使用的`llm_id`是"deepseek-chat"，温度设置为0.2，影响模型输出的随机性。

4. **后处理**：使用正则表达式清理返回的答案，提取关键词。

这些关键词随后用于查询向量数据库中的信息，作为搜索词或标识符来检索相关文档或数据点。在示例中，关键词被传递给`Wikipedia`组件，该组件根据提取的关键词检索相关内容<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/component/keyword.py)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/test/dsl_examples/keyword_wikipedia_and_generate.json)</sup>。


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To continue talking to [Dosu](https://dosu.dev), mention @dosu.*

comments_data.body: @dosu 是把一开始的句子生成的向量，以及将关键词再生成向量，一起放到向量数据库中查询吗

<!-- Answer -->
是的，一开始的句子和关键词都会被转换成向量，然后一起在向量数据库中进行查询。这可以从`get_relevant_ents_by_keywords`和`get_relevant_relations_by_txt`函数中看出，其中使用`get_vector`方法将关键词和文本都转换为向量（`matchDense`），然后在数据存储中进行搜索<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/graphrag/search.py)</sup>。

comments_data.body: @dosu 这里的大语言模型是和回答问题时的语言模型一样的吗

<!-- Answer -->
是的，`KeywordExtract`组件和`Generate`组件使用相同的语言模型，标识为`llm_id: "deepseek-chat"`。不过，它们的配置不同，以适应各自的任务。`KeywordExtract`组件专注于提取关键词，使用特定的提示和参数，而`Generate`组件则用于生成回答，处理从百度搜索中获取的内容，并考虑聊天历史<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/test/dsl_examples/keyword_wikipedia_and_generate.json)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/agent/test/dsl_examples/retrieval_relevant_keyword_baidu_and_generate.json)</sup><sup>[[3]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/agent/agent_component_reference/keyword.mdx)</sup>.

### 🤩 Community Reactions

- ["Yes, that was the problem, I can confirm it works fine now!"](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13115#issuecomment-1803510213)

comments_data.body: @dosu 利用关键词和查询问题的向量进行的检索是如何进行的？

<!-- Answer -->
检索过程利用关键词和查询问题的向量进行，是通过一种混合搜索方法实现的。RAGFlow结合了加权关键词相似度和加权向量余弦相似度。默认情况下，关键词相似度权重设为0.7，向量余弦相似度权重设为0.3。整体混合相似度分数通过将词项相似度分数乘以0.7和向量相似度分数乘以0.3来计算。如果使用重排序模型，关键词相似度会与加权向量重排序分数结合。相似度阈值设为0.2，意味着只有混合相似度分数达到20或更高的块才会被检索<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/dataset/run_retrieval_test.md)</sup>。


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To continue talking to [Dosu](https://dosu.dev), mention @dosu.*

## Dosu

Dosu is an AI-powered Github maintainer agent. Dosu helps open source maintainers encourage contributors, organize issues, triage bugs, answer questions, and more. 

### 🤩 Community Reactions

- ["The bot is right!"](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/issues/7684#issuecomment-1721430612)
- ["Yes, that was the problem, I can confirm it works fine now!"](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13115#issuecomment-1803510213)
- [“Thanks jinja2 worked perfectly.”](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13055#issuecomment-1801778473)
- ["Thank you, you have been very helpful."](https://github.com/astronomer/astronomer-cosmos/issues/670#issuecomment-1809333870)

comments_data.body: @dosu 我想你讲解的更详细一些

<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow的检索过程通过结合关键词和查询问题的向量来实现，具体步骤如下：

1. **关键词提取**：首先，`KeywordExtract`组件从用户的问题中提取重要的关键词或短语。这些关键词通过语言模型分析问题后生成。

2. **向量转换**：提取的关键词和原始问题文本都被转换为向量。这是通过`get_vector`方法实现的，确保关键词和文本都能在向量空间中表示。

3. **混合相似度计算**：在检索过程中，RAGFlow结合了加权关键词相似度和加权向量余弦相似度。默认情况下，关键词相似度的权重是0.7，而向量余弦相似度的权重是0.3。这意味着关键词在检索中的影响力更大。

4. **相似度阈值**：系统设定了一个相似度阈值，默认值为0.2。只有当混合相似度分数达到或超过这个阈值的文档块才会被检索到。

5. **重排序模型（可选）**：如果指定了重排序模型，系统会使用加权关键词相似度和加权重排序分数的组合来进行检索。这种方法会显著增加响应时间，但可能提高检索结果的相关性。

通过这种方式，RAGFlow能够有效地利用关键词和向量信息来检索相关文档，从而生成更准确和相关的回答<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/references/python_api_reference.md)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/web/src/locales/en.ts)</sup><sup>[[3]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/agent/agent_component_reference/retrieval.mdx)</sup><sup>[[4]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/dataset/run_retrieval_test.md)</sup>。


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To continue talking to [Dosu](https://dosu.dev), mention @dosu.*

---

## Dosu

Dosu is an AI-powered Github maintainer agent. Dosu helps open source maintainers encourage contributors, organize issues, triage bugs, answer questions, and more. 

### 🤩 Community Reactions

- ["The bot is right!"](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/issues/7684#issuecomment-1721430612)
- ["Yes, that was the problem, I can confirm it works fine now!"](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13115#issuecomment-1803510213)
- [“Thanks jinja2 worked perfectly.”](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/issues/13055#issuecomment-1801778473)
- ["Thank you, you have been very helpful."](https://github.com/astronomer/astronomer-cosmos/issues/670#issuecomment-1809333870)

comments_data.body: @dosu 这些相似度是如何计算得到的，向量检索是如何进行的

<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow 通过结合加权关键词相似度和加权向量余弦相似度或加权重排序分数来计算相似度。向量检索是通过将用户查询与存储在数据集中的文档块进行比较来实现的。任何相似度分数低于指定阈值的块都会被排除在结果之外。默认情况下，阈值设为0.2，这意味着只有混合相似度分数达到20或更高的块才会被检索。关键词相似度和其他相似度度量的总权重必须等于1.0，默认情况下，关键词相似度的权重为0.7。如果没有指定重排序模型，系统默认使用向量余弦相似度<sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/agent/agent_component_reference/retrieval.mdx)</sup><sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/web/src/locales/en.ts)</sup><sup>[[3]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/references/http_api_reference.md)</sup>。


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

comments_data.body: @dosu 关键词相似度和向量余弦相似度是如何计算得到的

<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow 计算关键词相似度和向量余弦相似度的过程如下：

1. **关键词相似度**：通过分析用户查询中的关键词，RAGFlow 使用加权关键词相似度来评估查询与文档块之间的相关性。关键词相似度的权重可以调整，默认值为0.7，意味着在混合相似度计算中，关键词相似度占据较大的比重 <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/references/python_api_reference.md)</sup>.

2. **向量余弦相似度**：RAGFlow 使用向量余弦相似度来计算用户查询与文档块的向量表示之间的相似度。向量余弦相似度通过计算两个向量之间的夹角来衡量它们的相似性。虽然具体实现细节在代码库中未明确提到，但通常是通过计算两个向量的点积并除以它们的模长来实现 <sup>[[2]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/references/http_api_reference.md)</sup>.

这两种相似度的组合用于检索相关文档块，以生成更准确的回答。权重的总和必须等于1.0，以确保平衡关键词和向量相似度的影响 <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/references/python_api_reference.md)</sup>.

comments_data.body: @dosu 混合相似度获得后下一步如何进行？多路召回应该就是使用不同的检索方式

<!-- Answer -->
在获得混合相似度后，RAGFlow 会根据相似度分数对文档块进行排序，并选择最相关的块进行进一步处理。具体步骤如下：

1. **排序和过滤**：根据混合相似度分数对文档块进行排序。只有那些相似度分数高于设定阈值的块才会被保留用于后续步骤。

2. **选择和生成**：选取相似度最高的前N个文档块（通常由参数`Top N`控制，默认值为8）作为输入，传递给生成组件（如`Generate`组件），以生成最终的回答。

关于多路召回，虽然具体实现细节在RAGFlow的文档中没有明确提到，但通常多路召回是指使用多种检索方法来提高召回率和结果的多样性。这可能包括：

- **关键词检索**：基于提取的关键词进行传统的文本匹配检索。
- **向量检索**：使用向量表示进行相似度计算，通常通过向量数据库实现。
- **混合检索**：结合关键词和向量相似度的混合方法，以提高检索的准确性和相关性。

通过结合这些不同的检索方式，系统可以更全面地覆盖潜在的相关文档，提高回答的质量和准确性。

issues.title: ROADMAP 2025
issues.body:
## v0.20.0
- [ ] A brand new agent and workflow builder: support agent and workflow orchestration in a unified canvas  
- [ ] Enable agents to call MCP tools ([#7936]([[Feature Request]: When can the agent support the invocation of MCP services? · Issue #7936 · infini](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7936)))  
- [ ] Support sharing agents with initial variables pre-configured ([#7291](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7291))  
- [ ] Display runtime logs when interacting with agents
- [ ] Refactor dataset parsing and chunking into a multi-step process  
- [ ] Add the ability to compare responses from different models to the same question within the chat module  
- [ ] Redesign the UI and introduce dark mode
- [ ] Implement EraRAG as an alternative for RAPTOR/GraphRAG. #8614


## v0.19.0
- [x] Support cross-language search in the knowledge base and chat modules. #7376  
- [x] Add a new code component to the Agent module. #4977  
- [x] #7623
- [x] #7608

## v0.18.0
- [x] #4344 
- [x] #5905
- [x] Agent can be shared betweem team members. #6222
- [x] Supports agent version history. #6130 
- [x] #6515 
- [x] OpenAI compatible API for chat assistant and agent. #6329 
- [x] Supports disabling user sign-up. #6327
- [x] Figures from PDF/Docx can be parsed via VLMs. #6278

## v0.17.0
- [x] #5173
- [x] Improve prompt reference form Agent #4764 
- [x] #5198


## v0.16.0
- [x] #4543
- [x] #4242
- [x] #4367
- [x] #3690

## Long-term plan

- [ ] RAGFlow documents #720 
- [ ] APIs #1102 

## Backlog

- [ ] Supports memory API for Agent #4213

## Previous roadmap

[ROADMAP 2024](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/1821)

If anyone had a similar issue or can give a hint on how to troubleshoot please let me know!

Hi  , same issue there .... I did test using http://host.docker.internal:11434/ as a base url ( that's probably the way to go specially in a docker deployment model) but I got an error "Hint 102 : Fail to access model(/mistral).**ERROR**: [Errno -2] Name or service not known " ...

Kool.  Will give it a try. 

FINDINGS:

But in terminal - ollama list - all the models are missing!!!

This didnt work for me either

If you are in docker and cannot connect to a service running on your host machine running on a local interface or loopback:
* localhost
* 127.0.0.1
* 0.0.0.0

Then in docker you need to replace that localhost part with host.docker.internal. For example, if running Ollama on the host machine, bound to http://127.0.0.1:11434/ you should put http://host.docker.internal:11434 into the connection URL in OLLAMA setup.

Important
On linux http://host.docker.internal:xxxx does not work.

我可以解决这个问题！
很简单！
在基础URL这一栏里填写：例如：http://192.168.0.100:11434/v1
注意：一定要加v1，我猜测这是ragflow模仿OpenAI的调用格式，而且在ollama的官方调用OpenAI格式的服务时，也是加上了v1!
这样就可以添加模型了！

> If you are in docker and cannot connect to a service running on your host machine running on a local interface or loopback:
> 
> * localhost
> * 127.0.0.1
> * 0.0.0.0
> 
> Then in docker you need to replace that localhost part with host.docker.internal. For example, if running Ollama on the host machine, bound to http://127.0.0.1:11434/ you should put http://host.docker.internal:11434 into the connection URL in OLLAMA setup.
> 
> Important On linux http://host.docker.internal:xxxx does not work.

This suggestion is so crucial that it needs to be inserted in the /docs/ollama.md imho.
How can I make it work on Linux lol.

> If you are in docker and cannot connect to a service running on your host machine running on a local interface or loopback:
> 
> * localhost
> * 127.0.0.1
> * 0.0.0.0
> 
> Then in docker you need to replace that localhost part with host.docker.internal. For example, if running Ollama on the host machine, bound to http://127.0.0.1:11434/ you should put http://host.docker.internal:11434 into the connection URL in OLLAMA setup.
> 
> Important On linux http://host.docker.internal:xxxx does not work.

`host.docker.internal` can work on Linux if you modify the docker-compose.yml by adding `extra_hosts` like this:

```
    extra_hosts:
      - "host.docker.internal:host-gateway"
```
Once `host-gateway` is mapped to `host.docker.internal`, you should be able to refer to a ollama instance running on the same host as ragflow (but not within the docker-compose) by referring to is as `http://host.docker.internal:11434/`

In `docker-compose-base.yml` I've changed these params:

to optimize memory consumption:
```
image: mysql:8.0
```

to wait until db is ready I exagerated these:
```
interval: 20s
timeout: 20s
retries: 20
```

finally:
```
mysql:
    image: mysql:8.0 # <--------
    container_name: ragflow-mysql
    environment:
      - MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=${MYSQL_PASSWORD}
      - TZ=${TIMEZONE}
    command:
      --max_connections=1000
      --character-set-server=utf8mb4
      --collation-server=utf8mb4_general_ci
      --default-authentication-plugin=caching_sha2_password # <-------- not shure if this change is usefull
      --tls_version="TLSv1.2,TLSv1.3"
      --init-file /data/application/init.sql
    ports:
      - ${MYSQL_PORT}:3306
    volumes:
      - mysql_data:/var/lib/mysql
      - ./init.sql:/data/application/init.sql
    networks:
      - ragflow
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "mysqladmin" ,"ping", "-uroot", "-p${MYSQL_PASSWORD}"]
      interval: 20s # <--------
      timeout: 20s # <--------
      retries: 20 # <--------
    restart: always
```

issues.title: [Question]: parsing in stuck when apply

labels.name: 🐞 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working, pull request that fix bug.

issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( 非英文标题的提交将会被直接关闭 ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem


I deployed an embedding model locally and connected it to ragflow through OpenAI-API-Compatible, but the parsing stuck consistently, as shown in the figure

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7bda9e25-9cea-494d-b0e5-dccae6dc4b40)

and the logs:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b2f53c9-0be4-4138-b71e-9bde0310418c)

The embedding service did not receive a request, and the only log was when it was added through OpenAI-API-Compatible;

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1367ee09-e73c-4fd8-952b-4306d5dd36f0)

comments_data.body:
<!-- Greeting -->
Hi @Jwpap! I'm [Dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot) and I’m helping the ragflow team.

<!-- Answer -->
Parsing getting stuck with a local OpenAI-API-Compatible embedding model is often due to configuration or registration issues. Here are the most likely causes and what you can check:

1. Make sure your embedding model is registered in `conf/llm_factories.json` with the correct format and that the backend recognizes it. The model identifier must match the `<model_name>@OpenAI-API-Compatible` pattern, and both parts must be non-empty strings. If the model isn't registered or the backend doesn't recognize the factory/provider, parsing won't proceed and your embedding service won't receive requests [(details)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8233) [(setup)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8059).

2. If you're on RAGFlow v0.19.0, there was a bug that prevented some custom models from working. This has been fixed in a later version. You can either update to a newer version or manually patch the code in your Docker container (edit `api/utils/api_utils.py` to include your model, then restart the container) [(reference)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8233).

3. Double-check your embedding model's `base_url` and network connectivity. If RagFlow can't reach your local embedding service, no requests will be sent. Sometimes, using `127.0.0.1` or `localhost` doesn't work inside Docker; try using the host's internal IP (e.g., `172.17.0.1:your_port`) [(example)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6048).

4. Make sure the task executor is running. In the web UI, check under System for the task executor's health status, or look for regular 'reported heartbeat' messages in the logs. If the executor is down, restart it [(troubleshooting)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8235).

5. If your embedding API's structure is different from what RagFlow expects (input: string or list of strings, output: embedding(s) in a predictable field), you may need to write a small adapter service [(integration details)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7863).

If you check these areas and parsing is still stuck, please share your `llm_factories.json` entry and any error logs you see in the RagFlow server or task executor logs.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

comments_data.body:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b52166a9-2670-472e-a789-b56cb845e60f) 
after annotating the code marked in red, it can be parsed normally。 the entrypoint.sh is used for what?

<!-- Answer -->
The entrypoint.sh script is the main startup script for the RAGFlow Docker container—it configures and launches all the core services inside the container, like the web server, task executor, and (optionally) the MCP server. It also processes environment variables and command-line arguments to control which components run and how they're configured. When the container starts, Docker runs this script automatically as defined in the Dockerfile's ENTRYPOINT directive [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/c8b1790c92f9f1fe90606bc4f283ec7e99bc973d/docker/entrypoint.sh).

If you commented out (annotated) the volume mount for entrypoint.sh in your docker-compose.yml and parsing started working, it's likely because your local copy of entrypoint.sh was either outdated or mismatched with the version inside the container. Overriding the container's built-in script with a local version can prevent critical background services (like the task executor, which handles parsing) from starting correctly, causing the system to hang. By removing the override, the container uses its own, version-matched entrypoint.sh, which ensures all required services start as expected [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/c8b1790c92f9f1fe90606bc4f283ec7e99bc973d/docker/docker-compose.yml).


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

comments_data.body: @dosu another question, I am currently using the official image. If I modify the local code and want to start the service with the local code, what should I do

<!-- Answer -->
You have two main options:

1. If you want to quickly test code changes, you can exec into the running container, modify the code (for example, with `docker exec -it ragflow-server bash` and editing files), then restart the container to apply the changes. This works for small tweaks but isn't ideal for ongoing development or version control [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8233).

2. For full development, it's better to run RAGFlow from source on your machine. Clone the repo, install dependencies, launch the required services (like MySQL, Redis, etc.) with Docker Compose, and run the backend/frontend locally. This way, any code changes you make are immediately reflected. There’s a step-by-step guide here: [https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/launch_ragflow_from_source](https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/launch_ragflow_from_source) [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6089).

If you use Docker Compose, you can also mount your local code directory into the container as a volume (in the `volumes` section), so the container uses your local files instead of the ones baked into the image. Just make sure the code inside the container matches your local changes and restart the service after edits.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

comments_data.body:
@dosu 
I want to deploy local services in the Ubuntu 20.04 container, but I encountered an issue where pyicu==2.15 cannot be installed when using UV Sync -- Python 3.10. Possible reason is that Ubuntu 20.04 version does not support installing pyicu==2.15. Is there a solution？

<!-- Answer -->
This is a known issue: pyicu==2.15 expects a newer ICU library than what Ubuntu 20.04 provides by default. The system ICU (libicu) on Ubuntu 20.04 is too old, which causes the build to fail with Python 3.10 and recent pyicu versions.

To fix it, you need to upgrade the ICU library to at least version 75. The recommended steps are:

1. Download and build ICU from source:
```bash
wget https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/releases/download/release-76-1/icu4c-76_1-src.tgz
tar -xzf icu4c-76_1-src.tgz
cd icu/source
./configure --prefix=/opt/icu
make -j
sudo make install
```
2. Set environment variables so PyICU can find the new ICU:
```bash
export LDFLAGS="-L/opt/icu/lib"
export CPPFLAGS="-I/opt/icu/include"
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/opt/icu/lib"
```
3. Then install PyICU:
```bash
pip install pyicu
```
or
```bash
sudo ICU_VERSION=76 pip install pyicu
```

This approach has resolved the same issue for others on Ubuntu 20.04 with Python 3.10 and pyicu 2.15. More details and discussion are available in the related issues: [issue 8110](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8110), [issue 5589](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5589).

If you still have trouble, make sure you have build tools and pkg-config installed (`sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config`).

comments_data.body: @dosu. python3 api/ragflow_server.py meet ValueError: not find model file path /workspace/ragflow/rag/res/deepdoc/det.onnx

<!-- Answer -->
The error means RAGFlow can't find the required OCR model file det.onnx in /workspace/ragflow/rag/res/deepdoc/. By default, RAGFlow tries to auto-download this file from HuggingFace (InfiniFlow/deepdoc). If your server can't access huggingface.co (due to firewall, proxy, or network limits), the download fails and you get this error.

To fix it:  
1. Make sure your server/container has network access to huggingface.co or hf-mirror.com, then restart the service and it should auto-download the file.  
2. If network access isn't possible, manually download det.onnx from https://huggingface.co/InfiniFlow/deepdoc and place it in /workspace/ragflow/rag/res/deepdoc/ inside your container or working directory.  
3. After the file is in place, restart ragflow_server.py and the error should be resolved.

This is required for all visual document parsing features in RAGFlow and is a documented setup step for air-gapped or restricted environments.

comments_data.body:
@dosu  anothor question

Resource punkt_tab not found.
  Please use the NLTK Downloader to obtain the resource:

  >>> import nltk
  >>> nltk.download('punkt_tab')

<!-- Answer -->
This error means the NLTK "punkt" tokenizer data is missing. You can fix it by running:

```python
import nltk
nltk.download('punkt')
```

This will download the required resource. Make sure your environment has internet access. If you want to download all NLTK data at once, you can use:

```bash
python -m nltk.downloader all
```

If you need to specify a custom download directory, use:

```python
nltk.download('punkt', download_dir='/your/path/to/nltk_data')
```

More details are in the related discussion [here](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6722).

comments_data.body: @dosu is there a way to deploy local services in docker in docker

<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow doesn't use traditional Docker-in-Docker (DinD), where you run a full Docker daemon inside a container. Instead, it uses a privileged service called sandbox-executor-manager, which mounts the host's Docker socket into the container. This lets the service launch and manage additional containers on the host for sandboxed code execution, but it doesn't start a nested Docker daemon or support general-purpose DinD workflows ([reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/5256980ffbf3b790c7f4583a76c7d18ce23b7580/docker/docker-compose-base.yml), [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/5256980ffbf3b790c7f4583a76c7d18ce23b7580/docs/guides/agent/sandbox_quickstart.md)).

If you want to deploy local services (like embedding models, databases, etc.) alongside RAGFlow, the recommended way is to use Docker Compose to define all your services in one file and run them together. This is simpler, safer, and fully supported.

If you have a specific use case that really needs DinD (like running containers inside containers for CI/CD), let me know your scenario—there may be a workaround, but it's not the standard or recommended approach for RAGFlow.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->

elastic_transport.ConnectionError: Connection error caused by: NewConnectionError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7fcad6e98c70>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused)
2025-06-25 16:23:06,872 INFO     165 HEAD http://localhost:1200/ [status:N/A duration:0.000s]
2025-06-25 16:23:06,872 WARNING  165 Node <Urllib3HttpNode(http://localhost:1200)> has failed for 8 times in a row, putting on 30 second timeout
2025-06-25 16:23:06,872 ERROR    165 Elasticsearch http://localhost:1200 is unhealthy in 120s.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/ragflow/rag/svr/task_executor.py", line 777, in <module>
    trio.run(main)
  File "/workspace/ragflow/.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/trio/_core/_run.py", line 2423, in run
    raise runner.main_task_outcome.error
  File "/workspace/ragflow/rag/svr/task_executor.py", line 753, in main
    settings.init_settings()
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/settings.py", line 163, in init_settings
    docStoreConn = rag.utils.es_conn.ESConnection()
  File "/workspace/ragflow/rag/utils/__init__.py", line 31, in _singleton
    instances[key] = cls(*args, **kw)
  File "/workspace/ragflow/rag/utils/es_conn.py", line 63, in __init__
    raise Exception(msg)
Exception: Elasticsearch http://localhost:1200 is unhealthy in 120s.

<!-- Answer -->
The error means RAGFlow can't connect to Elasticsearch at http://localhost:1200—either Elasticsearch isn't running, isn't listening on that port, or the config is pointing to the wrong place. This is a hard requirement: if ES isn't reachable, task_executor.py will keep retrying and eventually fail with "unhealthy in 120s" [details](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/340354b79c3487e2d29348fc21ef7a8d5140f375/rag/utils/es_conn.py).

Here's what to check:

1. Make sure Elasticsearch is running and listening on port 1200. If you're using Docker Compose, confirm the ES container is up and healthy (`docker ps` or `docker-compose ps`).
2. Check your config files: `.env`, `conf/service_conf.yaml`, and `docker/service_conf.yaml.template`. The ES host/port in these files must match where Elasticsearch is actually running. By default, it's `http://localhost:1200`, but in Docker Compose setups, it might be something like `http://es01:1200` [example config](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/8286).
3. If ES is running in another container, make sure the network settings allow access from the RAGFlow container. Try `curl http://localhost:1200` (or the configured address) from inside the RAGFlow container to verify connectivity.
4. If you change the config, restart both Elasticsearch and RAGFlow services.
5. If ES is running but still not accepting connections, check the Elasticsearch logs for errors.

If you need to point RAGFlow to an external or differently-named ES instance, update the host in your config files and restart [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5845).

comments_data.body:
@dosu ES is running in another container, curl http://172.17.0.1:1200 is ok, but i still meet  the error:
elastic_transport.ConnectionError: Connection error caused by: NewConnectionError(<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f54d89b7460>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused)
2025-06-25 17:32:13,091 INFO     716 HEAD http://localhost:1200/ [status:N/A duration:0.000s]
2025-06-25 17:32:13,091 WARNING  716 Node <Urllib3HttpNode(http://localhost:1200)> has failed for 8 times in a row, putting on 30 second timeout
2025-06-25 17:32:13,091 ERROR    716 Elasticsearch http://localhost:1200 is unhealthy in 120s.

<!-- Answer -->
RAGFlow is still trying to connect to http://localhost:1200 because that's the default in its config files. Inside a Docker container, 'localhost' refers to the container itself, not the host or other containers. Since your Elasticsearch is reachable at http://172.17.0.1:1200, you need to update the RAGFlow config to use this address.

If you're running with Docker Compose, edit your docker/.env file and set:
```
ES_HOST=172.17.0.1
ES_PORT=1200
```
Then, make sure your docker/service_conf.yaml.template uses these variables (it should by default: `hosts: 'http://${ES_HOST:-es01}:9200'`, so adjust the port if needed).

If you're running locally or not using Compose, update conf/service_conf.yaml:
```
es:
  hosts: 'http://172.17.0.1:1200'
```
After making changes, restart your RAGFlow service/container so it reloads the new settings. This should resolve the connection issue. For more details, see the relevant config examples and discussion [here](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/7353070f49d4377cce4b106115119e596e1a50b6/conf/service_conf.yaml) and [here](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/7353070f49d4377cce4b106115119e596e1a50b6/docker/.env).

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/ragflow_server.py", line 36, in <module>
    from api.apps import app
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/apps/__init__.py", line 137, in <module>
    client_urls_prefix = [
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/apps/__init__.py", line 138, in <listcomp>
    register_page(path) for dir in pages_dir for path in search_pages_path(dir)
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/apps/__init__.py", line 120, in register_page
    spec.loader.exec_module(page)
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/apps/canvas_app.py", line 20, in <module>
    from api.db.services.canvas_service import CanvasTemplateService, UserCanvasService
  File "/workspace/ragflow/api/db/services/canvas_service.py", line 20, in <module>
    from agent.canvas import Canvas
  File "/workspace/ragflow/agent/canvas.py", line 22, in <module>
    from agent.component import component_class
  File "/workspace/ragflow/agent/component/__init__.py", line 41, in <module>
    from .exesql import ExeSQL, ExeSQLParam
  File "/workspace/ragflow/agent/component/exesql.py", line 24, in <module>
    import pyodbc
ImportError: libodbc.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

<!-- Answer -->
The error ImportError: libodbc.so.2: cannot open shared object file means your system is missing the ODBC libraries required by pyodbc, which RAGFlow imports by default—even if you don't use MSSQL features. To fix this on Ubuntu 20.04, run:

```bash
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y unixodbc unixodbc-dev
```
This will install the required libraries and allow pyodbc to import successfully, letting RAGFlow start up as expected [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7441).

For the "can't import package 'torch'" message: if you need torch features, install it with
```bash
uv sync --python 3.10 --all-extras
```
or
```bash
pip install .[full]
```
If you're using the slim version of RAGFlow and don't need torch, you can ignore this message—it won't affect core functionality [reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7552).

Let me know if you hit any other errors after installing the ODBC libraries.

issues.title: Feat: Support production deployment mode by using gunicorn.

labels.name: 💞 feature
labels.description: Feature request, pull request that fullfill a new feature.

labels.name: size:XL
labels.description: This PR changes 500-999 lines, ignoring generated files.

issues.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

This PR adds Gunicorn support to enable production-ready deployment of the RAGFlow framework, replacing the default development server with a robust WSGI HTTP server. This change significantly improves performance, stability, and concurrency handling in real-world deployments.

### Type of change

- [x] New Feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Performance Improvement

Would you please check if the test cases can run in your local environment?
I'm trying.

Hi team, @JinHai-CN @ZhenhangTung @KevinHuSh  

Apologies for the earlier PR that failed CI. I have since:

* **Re‑worked the build** – all checks now pass on my own CI runner (8 vCPU / 32 GB RAM).
* **Added Gunicorn + gevent** for true production deployment.
* **Hardened thread‑safety** issues that surfaced with multi‑worker Gunicorn.
* Updated Docker entrypoint, added `conf/gunicorn.conf.py`, a WSGI module and pinned the required `gunicorn` / `gevent` dependencies.
* Minor tweaks: safer table creation, clearer startup warnings, distributed‑lock for DB‑init, etc.
  (See full diff in this PR.)

Although the test suite is green, these changes have **not yet been exercised in a live production environment**. Could you please run a thorough review and, if possible, a staging deployment to confirm everything behaves as expected?

Thank you for your time and feedback!

Additionally, are there any stable methods to trigger these two issues currently?

> Hello, @ericwu0930 Could you please tell me what the startup parameters are for the above two issues (except the known --workers=20)? Are they using the sync mode or gevent mode? Additionally, are there any stable methods to trigger these two issues currently? sync mode. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a6673d03-3361-4c9f-ba76-2ea6f29bb9f9) The first issue is triggered when I requested /api/v1/retrieval continuously. And it was resolved by reducing MySQL's max connections to 100. Actually, I haven't figured out the reason completely. Another one has no idea. Except for being kicked out immediately after login which prevents me from operating on the ragflow website, everything goes well.

Hi @ericwu0930 , I've also met a similar 401 issue on my internal deployment before, the reproduce steps from my side are:

1. start multiple instances with the development server, use a nginx to proxy to these ragflow-01 / ragflow-02 instances;
2. integrate with okta login sso and try to login, sometimes it would be able to login and then throw 401, sometimes it would directly return "invalid_state" 

I've fixed this issue by setting SECRET_KEY and introducing flask redis session to share the session across multiple ragflow backend instances, will take time to submit an individual PR for sharing this fix.

@zyoung1212 @ericwu0930 could you run the ragflow backend service normally ? I've tried this PR and there are too many issues...

For example, when it's sync mode (gevent would also have issue), it would stuck on exiting master process and must kill it via kill -9 :

```
# environment: macOS M1 PRO, Python 3.10.13
$ gunicorn --config conf/gunicorn.conf.py  api.wsgi:application
...
[2025-06-18 15:10:41 +0800] [30246] [INFO] Worker exiting (pid: 30246)
[2025-06-18 15:10:41 +0800] [30240] [INFO] Worker exiting (pid: 30240)
[2025-06-18 15:10:44 +0800] [29891] [INFO] Shutting down: Master # will stuck on here forever, and then I must kill it by kill -9
[1]    29891 killed     gunicorn --config conf/gunicorn.conf.py api.wsgi:application
```

And also when I'm trying to add a chunk by calling `POST {{host}}/api/v1/datasets/f1f8ec244abd11f09b2076cb1995044e/documents/ecf88c024abd11f09b2076cb1995044e/chunks` API, it would also return 500 / 504:

```
objc[30573]: +[MPSGraphObject initialize] may have been in progress in another thread when fork() was called.
objc[30573]: +[MPSGraphObject initialize] may have been in progress in another thread when fork() was called. We cannot safely call it or ignore it in the fork() child process. Crashing instead. Set a breakpoint on objc_initializeAfterForkError to debug.
[2025-06-18 15:13:30 +0800] [30510] [ERROR] Worker (pid:30573) was sent SIGKILL! Perhaps out of memory?
RAGFlow worker about to be forked
[2025-06-18 15:13:30 +0800] [30581] [INFO] Booting worker with pid: 30581
RAGFlow worker spawned (pid: 30581)
```

@Colstuwjx @zyoung1212 
The root cause has been identified. On June 11, I started 10 Gunicorn processes. One of them crashed and restarted on June 17. RagFlow's JWT is derived from secret_key, but the original RagFlow did not assign a value to secret_key, so it defaulted to the process's startup date. As a result, 9 machines had JWTs dated 2025-06-11, while the new one had a JWT dated 2025-06-17. If a user's login request is routed to one process but subsequent API calls hit a different process with a mismatched JWT date, they get kicked out.
![企业微信截图_17502420362075](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1a5bc779-bd61-45a4-8d30-96ff6eb08a02)

I've solved this by setting SECRET_KEY. I think it's no need to introduce flask redis session.

issues.title: [Question]: What type of GPU and how many GPUs are recommended to fasten the speed of parsing files?
issues.body:
### Describe your problem

I use CPU to parse a PDF file whose size is 55MB, but is cost about 1 hour. It's too slow to create knowledge base in ragflow. What type of GPU are recommended to use to fasten the speed of parsing files? And how many GPUs? Would RTX 4090 or RTX A6000 is recommended? Thanks.

comments_data.body:
Please deploy an embedding service with Ollama/Xinference on your GPUs.
That's gona accelerate much more.

> Please deploy an embedding service with Ollama/Xinference on your GPUs. That's gona accelerate much more.

I prefer vllm. So you recommend to deploy an embedding model and then add it as embedding model onto ragflow? Which embedding model is recommended?

Create a knowledge base is not time-consuming; parsing file is. Here are some tips: https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/accelerate_doc_indexing

Or, you can use docker-compose-gpu.yml to start your service. This accelerates DeepDoc tasks using GPU, requiring RAGFlow v0.16.0+.
@zengqingfu1442 Yes. The recommended embedding model is `bge-m3`.

> Please deploy an embedding service with Ollama/Xinference on your GPUs. That's gona accelerate much more.

As shown below, this file whose size is only 1MB, is cost 13 minutes to parse it. But i find that OCR part is 3.31s,  Layout analysis is 1.80s, embedding is 6.34s.  But is waited about 12 minutes for the task to be received(i used the builtin BAAT/bge-large-zh-v1.5 model), i understand this because at that same time a big PDF file about 55M is being parsed on the same machine with CPU. So what i want to express is that the main spending time should not only include embedding, right?
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/35dc5d68-6be8-4621-abb8-cef0915bc789)

You are right in that embedding is not the only stage that takes time. You toggled on RAPTOR, and this is another time consumer. 

BTW, embedding models are for *offline* processing, it does not contribute to the performance of question answering, which is in real-time.
So the OCR runs on CPU by default?
Yes, you are right.

> Create a knowledge base is not time-consuming; parsing file is. Here are some tips: https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/accelerate_doc_indexing
> 
> Or, you can use docker-compose-gpu.yml to start your service. This accelerates DeepDoc tasks using GPU, requiring RAGFlow v0.16.0+.

I compiled a Docker image from the source code to start. If OCR uses GPU, LIGHT=0 is required. Docker-compose-gpu.yml does indeed use GPU to accelerate ORC, but there will be OOM issues, and in the case of multiple graphics cards, only the first graphics card will be used. Can you solve this problem? Thank you.

@said-what-sakula `onnxruntime-gpu leaking memory` is a known [issue](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/9509). We've add code according to that onnxruntime issue but it doesn't help. v0.17.0 add `Support the use of LLM to parse documents(experimental)`.

Can  RAPTOR and Extracting knowledge graph (GraphRAG) also run on GPU to accelerate?

> You are right in that embedding is not the only stage that takes time. You toggled on RAPTOR, and this is another time consumer.
> 
> BTW, embedding models are for _offline_ processing, it does not contribute to the performance of question answering, which is in real-time.
Thanks @yuzhichang for sharing the story behind this. @said-what-sakula You can take a look at Feature 5 of RAGFlow's latest release notes: https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/release_notes#v0170

> Can RAPTOR and Extracting knowledge graph (GraphRAG) also run on GPU to accelerate?
> 
> > You are right in that embedding is not the only stage that takes time. You toggled on RAPTOR, and this is another time consumer.
> > BTW, embedding models are for _offline_ processing, it does not contribute to the performance of question answering, which is in real-time.

GPU can't be used to accelerate RAPTOR and knowledge graph.

> Thanks [@yuzhichang](https://github.com/yuzhichang) for sharing the story behind this. [@said-what-sakula](https://github.com/said-what-sakula) You can take a look at Feature 5 of RAGFlow's latest release notes: https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/release_notes#v0170

I didn't expect the update to be so fast. I will go check the update document and try it out

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b4e94c6-c31a-4a6a-8dac-e2fa0400a328)

It seems that the graph in PDF file can not be parsed.
Could you use the keywords in the diagram to search for the related chunk?
Perhaps i should choose "Book" Chunk method to parse the PDF file because it is an e-book.

> Perhaps i should choose "Book" Chunk method to parse the PDF file because it is an e-book.

You don't have to change chunk method. Check if the diagram is in the created chunk first.
请问您的pdf解析速度如何？使用GPU加速了吗
我使用官方代码解析pdf的时候发现也是无法使用的而且对传输 文件还有大小限制 ，请问如何去除文件大小影响，超过100的pdf扫描件就无法上传

comments_data.body: 我也遇到过同样的问题，在产生的响应信息不多时，这个问题不会发生。但是当响应信息比较长时，就一定会发生，并且和响应信息的长度无关，不管是1000字还是2000字的响应信息，都会在快响应结束时报错，并且已经响应的信息会被全部清空。
我也遇到过这样的问题。
同样, 用的是open ai兼容接口的自部署的deepseek-r1
我也是遇到过，输出部分内容后出现提示ERROR: Tenant not found，不知道如何解决，猜测可能是网络接口不稳定导致的

已经给出修改代码了，参考下面修改api/db/services/llm_service.py即可解决。
https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/commit/849d9eb463c22849ec619824e86c7d5305d2958e
我的解决办法是Modeling Setting里，把Max Tokens这个选项disable掉。
同样遇到了，使用本地的ollama的 qwen2.5:7b

遇到同样的问题，按这种方法设置了，问题还是没依旧，请问大神还有解决方法吗？

> 已经给出修改代码了，参考下面修改api/db/services/llm_service.py即可解决。 [849d9eb](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/commit/849d9eb463c22849ec619824e86c7d5305d2958e)

May I ask if copying this code to your own project and restarting it is sufficient, or if you need to pull the image again

> > 已经给出修改代码了，参考下面修改api/db/services/llm_service.py即可解决。 [849d9eb](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/commit/849d9eb463c22849ec619824e86c7d5305d2958e)
> 
> May I ask if copying this code to your own project and restarting it is sufficient, or if you need to pull the image again

You only need to modify this file inside the ragflow container, no need to pull the image again

> > 已经给出修改代码了，参考下面修改api/db/services/llm_service.py即可解决。 [849d9eb](https://bgithub.xyz/infiniflow/ragflow/commit/849d9eb463c22849ec619824e86c7d5305d2958e)
> 
> May I ask if copying this code to your own project and restarting it is sufficient, or if you need to pull the image again

我直接修改了文件，发现RAGFlow运行不正常了。后来我直接把RAGFlow升级成nightly版了。

How to modify this file inside the ragflow container？ I found that disable max tokens is not useful，ERROR: Tenant not found will appeared after the answer，and answer is disappeared。
怎么修改docker里面的文件啊？我改max token 不管用啊，回答出现后会清空，出现Tenant not found

issues.title: [Bug]: Login RAGFlow with error code 502

labels.name: 🐞 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working, pull request that fix bug.

issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same bug?

- [x] I have checked the existing issues.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

20250209

### RAGFlow image version

v0.16.0

### Other environment information

```Markdown
OS type：centos7.9
Hardware parameters: 处理器8 内存16
```

### Actual behavior

centos7.9根据https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/ 描述部署安装后，修改了docker/.env 中相应地更新变量 RAGFLOW_IMAGE=infiniflow/ragflow:v0.16.0
；登录页面输入邮箱密码，点击登录没有反应，f12查看后502错误，

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9595511-3f08-49a2-9f40-3e08d69c32a1)

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
根据以下官网连接步骤执行：https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/
```

### Additional information


以下是具体的命令调试：

这个不是BUG，是使用问题，如果你是如下和我一样的报错，可以参考我的解决步骤
是使用问题，我这边完美解决了这个问题，解决步骤如下：
问题: docker logs -f 917c48df8473(infiniflow/ragflow:v0.16.0的容器日志)
peewee.OperationalError: (1045, "Access denied for user 'root'@'172.24.0.6' (using password: YES)")

# 问题原因，这个镜像的mysql密码一致是默认密码，只要配置没改全就会报错

解决办法:
1. 停止并移除现有容器
cd ./docker
docker compose -f docker-compose.yml down
2. 删除或备份数据卷
备份命令：
cp -r /home/data/docker/volumes/docker_esdata01 /backup/docker_esdata01_backup
cp -r /home/data/docker/volumes/docker_minio_data /backup/docker_minio_data_backup
cp -r /home/data/docker/volumes/docker_mysql_data /backup/docker_mysql_data_backup
cp -r /home/data/docker/volumes/docker_redis_data /backup/docker_redis_data_backup
删除命令：
docker volume rm docker_esdata01
docker volume rm docker_minio_data
docker volume rm docker_mysql_data
docker volume rm docker_redis_data

3. 删除未使用的网络配置
docker network prune

4. 修改docker/.env 、 docker/service_conf.yaml.template和conf/service_conf.yaml 这三个文件
中所有的密码，设置成自己的，务必这三处都保持一致（重要）
5. 重新启动服务
cd ./docker
[root@localhost docker]# docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d

@yangboz , I posted the exact same issue in response to https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/231?notification_referrer_id=NT_kwDOAANVr7IxMDEyNDA5ODExNjoyMTg1NDM#issuecomment-2153495658.  The issue was closed with no explanation.  This was (is) a legitimate problem.

We followed, exactly, the instructions at https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/#start-up-the-server.  Twice, actually.  And we were stuck with the error.

Today, we pulled the latest from the repo (again), and then ran `docker compose up -d` and it came to life.  Try these steps.  And note you may still get an error, but it's likely an error saying you haven't supplied keys for AI integration.

1. Pull the latest from git@github.com:infiniflow/ragflow.git.
2. Assuming it's created in a directory named `ragflow`, cd to `ragflow/docker`.
3. run `chmod ugo+x ./entrypoint.sh`.
4. run `docker compose up -d`

It should come up.  At the time of this posting, `HEAD` points to `#957cd55`
verified it only works with 0.7.0 version  on ubuntu22.04,  except on macOS M1 with any version of it . : -(

我用中文回答吧，我也碰到了这个问题，我是win11 docker桌面版，用的是DEV分支。
进入elasticsearch docker执行设置用户名和密码的命令，重置所有密码为：infini_rag_flow

1.docker exec -it ragflow-es-01 /bin/bash
2.bin/elasticsearch-setup-passwords interactive 

密码重置完成后，等待1分钟左右就可以正常使用了

In my case it resolved when I update the es hosts to below on service_conf.yaml, it it helps anyone.
```
es:
  hosts: 'http://ragflow-es-01:9200'
```

This could be an overly excessive solution, but you can just edit `/etc/hosts` or alternatively, configure the DNS to point the resolution of `es01` to `127.0.0.1`.
Also notice that for some reason the es01 is running at port 1200 rather than 9200 on the host. You can find it out by `docker ps`.

> In my case it resolved when I update the es hosts to below on service_conf.yaml, it it helps anyone.
>

> es:
>   hosts: 'http://ragflow-es-01:9200'
> ```

I also tried to `bin/elasticsearch-setup-passwords interactive` to reset all the passwords to `infini_rag_flow`, but it's the same error.

issues.title: [Question]:when conducting a knowledge base search in the chat interface, it was found that ollama has a high cpu usage rate?

labels.name: 🐞 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working, pull request that fix bug.

issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( 非英文标题的提交将会被直接关闭 ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Describe your problem

Currently, when conducting a knowledge base search in the chat interface, it was found that ollama has a high cpu usage rate, but the GPU load is indeed empty, and the search takes more than ten minutes to complete. What happened during this process? Why does such a phenomenon occur?

comments_data.body: @dosubot

<!-- Answer -->
Based on the information available, the high CPU usage and empty GPU load during knowledge base searches with the Ollama model in the RAGFlow chat interface may be due to the Ollama model not utilizing the GPU as expected. This can happen if the environment is not configured to force all model layers to run on the GPU—by default, some layers may fall back to the CPU, leading to high CPU usage and slow performance.

To address this, you can try setting the following environment variables before launching the Ollama service:

```bash
export OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999
export SYCL_PI_LEVEL_ZERO_USE_IMMEDIATE_COMMANDLISTS=1
export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1
export ZES_ENABLE_SYSMAN=1
export SYCL_CACHE_PERSISTENT=1
```

These settings are especially important if you are using Intel Arc™ A-Series Graphics on Linux (Kernel 6.2 or newer). Setting `OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999` ensures all model layers use the GPU, which should reduce CPU load and improve performance. More details can be found in the [official deployment guide](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/models/deploy_local_llm.mdx).

If you have already set these variables and are still experiencing issues, there may be other factors at play, such as software limitations, model compatibility, or integration details within RAGFlow. At this time, there is no additional documentation or issue thread with a confirmed solution for this specific problem.

If you need further troubleshooting, please provide details about your hardware, operating system, and the exact Ollama model you are using.

comments_data.body: @KevinHuSh I found the same problem after updating ragflow to 0.19.0. When using agent based on models in ollama, the GPU is 0 but CPU is extremly high. What's going on? There wasn't such situation before updating.
SAME PROBLEM
I have tried a temporary solution, OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999 in the ollama service,But I don't know the root cause

# /etc/systemd/system/ollama.service
[Unit]
Description=Ollama Service
After=network-online.target

[Service]
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/ollama serve
User=ollama
Group=ollama
.........
+ Environment="OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999"

> # /etc/systemd/system/ollama.service
> [Unit] Description=Ollama Service After=network-online.target
> 
> [Service] ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/ollama serve User=ollama Group=ollama .........
> 
> * Environment="OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999"

Mine is on windows and i have tried to add enviornment, but the problem is still happening.
"OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999" doesn't work. Even if this option is set, this problem will recur
@dosubot

<!-- Answer -->
The high CPU usage and empty GPU load with Ollama models in RAGFlow after updating to 0.19.0 is likely due to how GPU resources are managed in newer versions. The RAGFlow codebase itself does not control whether Ollama uses the CPU or GPU; it delegates all hardware decisions to the Ollama backend via its API. This means that if Ollama is not configured or able to use the GPU, all inference will run on the CPU, causing the symptoms you describe.

One known cause is the context size (`num_ctx` parameter). If this is set too high (for example, 32768), Ollama may run into GPU resource constraints and fall back to CPU, especially in newer versions after v0.17.2. Reducing or removing the `num_ctx` parameter can resolve this and allow the GPU to be used again. This issue is documented in recent discussions and is specific to newer versions of RAGFlow and Ollama models [(source)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6584).

Other performance tips include disabling the reranker feature, turning off "Use RAPTOR to enhance retrieval," and disabling "Auto-keyword" and "Auto-question" features, as these can all increase CPU load if left enabled [(source)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7535).

If you have already set environment variables like `OLLAMA_NUM_GPU=999` and the problem persists, double-check the Ollama backend logs and configuration. The RAGFlow client code does not enforce or log the backend device status, so any device selection issues must be resolved in the Ollama server environment.

If you continue to see high CPU usage and no GPU load, try lowering or commenting out the `num_ctx` parameter in your Ollama model configuration and restart the Ollama service. This has resolved similar issues for other users in recent versions [(source)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6584).

Let me know if you need more specific troubleshooting steps or have questions about your configuration.

comments_data.body:
<!-- Answer -->
The context size (`num_ctx`) in your OllamaChat class is determined by the `_calculate_dynamic_ctx` method, which sums up the estimated token count for all messages in the history, applies a 1.2x buffer, and then rounds up to the nearest multiple of 8192 tokens. This logic is hardcoded and not configurable via environment variables or runtime parameters. To reduce `num_ctx`, you have two main options:

1. **Reduce the message history size or content length**: Fewer or shorter messages in `history` will directly lower the calculated context size.
2. **Modify the source code**: You can edit the `_calculate_dynamic_ctx` method to use a smaller buffer ratio (for example, change `1.2` to `1.0`), or set a lower minimum block size (change `8192` to a smaller value), or even cap the maximum context size. For example:

```python
# In rag/llm/chat_model.py
def _calculate_dynamic_ctx(self, history):
    ...
    # Apply a smaller buffer ratio
    total_tokens_with_buffer = int(total_tokens * 1.0)
    # Lower the minimum context size
    if total_tokens_with_buffer <= 4096:
        ctx_size = 4096
    else:
        ctx_multiplier = (total_tokens_with_buffer // 4096) + 1
        ctx_size = ctx_multiplier * 4096
    # Optionally, cap the maximum context size
    ctx_size = min(ctx_size, 8192)
    return ctx_size
```
[Reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/37998abef39993f43ab0ab7e47a155c314b1eef7/rag/llm/chat_model.py)

Reducing `num_ctx` can help prevent high CPU usage and force Ollama to use the GPU, especially if your hardware has limited GPU memory. This approach has resolved similar issues for other users when large context sizes caused Ollama to fall back to CPU-only inference [Reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6584).

For further performance improvements, consider disabling features like the reranker, RAPTOR retrieval, auto-keyword, and auto-question, as these can also increase CPU load [Reference](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/7535).

comments_data.body: Now the local environment is using a docker image. How should it be modified. @dosubot

<!-- Answer -->
To reduce the context size (`num_ctx`) in your Docker-based RAGFlow environment, you need to modify the `_calculate_dynamic_ctx` method in the Python source code, then rebuild and redeploy your Docker image. Here’s how you can do it:

1. Edit the file `rag/llm/chat_model.py` in your local copy of the RAGFlow source. Locate the `_calculate_dynamic_ctx` method in the `OllamaChat` class. Adjust the buffer ratio, block size, or cap the maximum context size. For example, you might change:

```python
# Original logic
total_tokens_with_buffer = int(total_tokens * 1.2)
if total_tokens_with_buffer <= 8192:
    ctx_size = 8192
else:
    ctx_multiplier = (total_tokens_with_buffer // 8192) + 1
    ctx_size = ctx_multiplier * 8192
```

to something like:

```python
total_tokens_with_buffer = int(total_tokens * 1.0)
if total_tokens_with_buffer <= 4096:
    ctx_size = 4096
else:
    ctx_multiplier = (total_tokens_with_buffer // 4096) + 1
    ctx_size = ctx_multiplier * 4096
ctx_size = min(ctx_size, 8192)  # Optional cap
```
This will reduce the context size and help avoid high CPU usage and CPU fallback when GPU memory is limited [(reference)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/37998abef39993f43ab0ab7e47a155c314b1eef7/rag/llm/chat_model.py).

2. Save your changes.

3. Rebuild your Docker image. In your project root, run:
```bash
docker build -t your-custom-ragflow .
```
or, if you use Docker Compose:
```bash
docker-compose build
```
This ensures your code changes are included in the new image [(reference)](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/37998abef39993f43ab0ab7e47a155c314b1eef7/Dockerfile).

4. Restart your container using the new image:
```bash
docker-compose up -d
```
or with plain Docker:
```bash
docker run ... your-custom-ragflow
```

No Docker-specific environment variables are needed for this change; the adjustment is purely in the Python code. After redeploying, the new context size logic will take effect for all OllamaChat operations in your container.

If you use a prebuilt image and cannot rebuild, you would need to mount the modified Python file into the container, but rebuilding is the recommended and cleanest approach.

Mine cannot set this because the space for GPU is limited and I have other use for other software which have to free the model of ollama, is there any other plan? @KevinHuSh

issues.title: [Bug]: GraphRAG will not finish - multiple failures and parsing stuck after 36 hours and $200 on openai-mini models

labels.name: 🐞 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working, pull request that fix bug.

issues.body:
### Self Checks

- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Non-english title submitions will be closed directly ( 非英文标题的提交将会被直接关闭 ) ([Language Policy](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5910)).
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

ge3e7c7dd

### RAGFlow image version

System v0.18.0-178-ge3e7c7dd full

### Other environment information

```Markdown
ARM Oracle Cloud Apex A1 instances
```

### Actual behavior

GraphRAG doesnt finish even on single page documents, Its like the queue gets broken and it restarts - this causes a HUGE number of calls to the LLM to catch up - this needs to be looked at to solve because its not feasible to use this right now.

### Expected behavior

If RagFlow crashes - this should pick up where it left off without having to restart huge sections of the process (its a slow and expensive process already). I think additional logging might be helpful as its hard to see what is happening under the hood here

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
I guess just upload any number of PDF and Markdown documents - especially ones that build a complex knowledge graph
```

### Additional information

This is an example of one that has gone faster (I am running it on a local GPU):

comments_data.body:
<!-- Answer -->
There are several known issues and recent changes in RAGFlow that may be related to the GraphRAG restart and performance problems you’re experiencing.

First, the use of RedisDistributedLock in the GraphRAG codebase is intended to manage task locks and prevent concurrent processing issues, but if a lock is not released properly (for example, due to a crash or timeout), tasks can get stuck or restart inefficiently. This can lead to repeated LLM calls and excessive processing times, as you described. The logs and code indicate that entity resolution and graph merging are managed asynchronously and rely on these locks, so any interruption can cause the process to start over rather than resume from the last checkpoint. This is especially problematic on resource-constrained environments like ARM Oracle Cloud A1 instances, where timeouts or deadlocks are more likely to occur due to slower processing or higher contention for resources.

Recent issues and discussions suggest that similar problems have been observed by other users. For example, tasks can be abandoned after several failed attempts, and restarting the ragflow-server container or the Redis service has been suggested as a workaround to clear stuck queues or recover from deadlocks. Processing one document at a time has also been recommended for complex documents to avoid resource contention and task failures. The docker-compose configuration uses a "restart: on-failure" policy, which may cause the service to restart but not always recover the task state cleanly, especially if the underlying queue or lock is in a bad state. See these related discussions:  
- ["Task is abandoned after 3 times attempts"](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5987)  
- ["How do I empty the processing task queue?"](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5537)

There have also been significant recent changes to the GraphRAG codebase, and some issues (such as empty chunks or stalled progress logs) have been fixed in the nightly build image. Upgrading to the latest nightly build is recommended, as it contains fixes for several task management and progress reporting bugs that are not present in earlier versions. See:  
- ["Parsing Status do not 100% when the file have been done"](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6432)  
- ["Recent changes in the GraphRAG codebase"](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6454)

For debugging and logging, the codebase already includes logging at various stages of task execution, lock acquisition, and error handling. You can increase the logging level to DEBUG or add more granular logs around lock acquisition/release and task state transitions in files like `graphrag/general/index.py`, `api/ragflow_server.py`, and `rag/svr/task_executor.py` to help pinpoint where tasks are stalling or restarting. The logging system is designed to capture exceptions and stack traces, which can be useful for diagnosing deadlocks or missed releases of locks. See examples of logging and lock management in:  
- [`api/ragflow_server.py`](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/api/ragflow_server.py)  
- [`rag/svr/task_executor.py`](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/rag/svr/task_executor.py)

In summary:  
- Try upgrading to the latest nightly build of RAGFlow, as it contains fixes for several task management issues.
- If tasks get stuck, try restarting the Redis service or the ragflow-server container to clear the queue and recover pending tasks.
- For complex documents, process one at a time to avoid resource contention.
- Increase logging verbosity and consider adding more logs around lock handling and task state transitions to help diagnose where the process is stalling or restarting.

If you continue to see the issue after these steps, capturing and sharing detailed logs (especially around lock acquisition/release and task restarts) will help further diagnose the root cause.

@dosubot - how can I restart this?

<!-- Answer -->
To restart the task executor queue in RAGFlow when tasks are stuck, the recommended approach is to restart the Redis service, which manages the task queue. You can do this with:

```
docker restart ragflow-redis
```

This command will clear the processing task queue and allow pending tasks to be picked up again by the executor without losing their state, as task progress and assignments are tracked in Redis and the executor is designed to recover pending tasks on startup. This approach is supported by maintainers and has been used to resolve similar issues with stuck or abandoned tasks in RAGFlow [[source]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5537).

If you continue to experience issues with tasks not resuming or progress stalling, make sure you are using the latest nightly build of RAGFlow, as several bugs related to task management and progress reporting have been fixed in recent versions [[source]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/6432). Also, for large or complex documents, processing one document at a time can help avoid resource contention and further task failures [[source]](https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/issues/5987).

If you see persistent problems after restarting Redis, you may also try restarting the ragflow-server container to ensure all components are in sync.

comments_data.body: @dosu @dosubot this doesnt clear the redis queue - nothing changes. In the redis DB there are strings with many files in them, sets (TASKEXE), sorted_sets(task_executor), streams(rag_flow_svr_queue). How can I reset redis properly to pick up and restart the tasks that are sitting at 97% and with status: created task graphrag Task has been received. If I clear out Redis fully by deleting the contents would this lose all the chunks of data? or are they stored elsewhere?

@voycey 
Would you share an sample file with us? 
What's the RAM size of your server, and how many task executors you've started?
And I did't see any error log stack here, did I miss anything?
kai.hu@infiniflow.org

There are no errors that's the thing, the process just does not finish, errors would be easier to solve.

I will send you a file shortly but they are mostly PDFs, even small .MD files of 1 page are failing or taking extraordinarily long to compete.

I'll send my settings for graphrag, and a pdf shortly!

Example document:

https://www.fwc.gov.au/document-search/view/3/aHR0cHM6Ly9zYXNyY2RhdGFwcmRhdWVhYS5ibG9iLmNvcmUud2luZG93cy5uZXQvZW50ZXJwcmlzZWFncmVlbWVudHMvMjAyMy85L2FlNTIxNDkyLnBkZg2?sid=&q=HEADSPACE%24%24ENTERPRISE%24%24AGREEMENT%24%242023

[ae521492.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20584329/ae521492.pdf)

Settings for GraphRAG on this are using openai o4-mini-high but I think you can try any other reasonably sized PDF and an API based model and it will get stuck!
@voycey The download link seemed not correct.
@KevinHuSh They both work for me - the first link is the direct item from the government website - the second is the PDF uploaded to Github?

> [@KevinHuSh](https://github.com/KevinHuSh) They both work for me - the first link is the direct item from the government website - the second is the PDF uploaded to Github?

Downloaded successfully!
This bug should have been fixed already. Are you still experiencing with this bug? @voycey
I saw the release, I'm going to redeploy things tonight so I'll let you know 🙏

@yingfeng @KevinHuSh - This is performing better but it is still not working properly. 
I have 50 documents each with between 1-10 pages and they dont finish. I have left them running all weekend and only about 6 of them have completed
LightRAG (https://github.com/HKUDS/LightRAG) performs properly on these documents and takes between 3 and 20 minutes to process each one.

They still dont finish in RagFlow using Light knowledgegraph methodology unfortunately.
What I dont understand is why the LLM connection is often being held open for 2+ hours, there is no way an LLM can take that long to respond, this blocks all other parallel requests that should be being made.

issues.title: [Bug]: Failed to resolve 'es01'

labels.name: 🐞 bug
labels.description: Something isn't working, pull request that fix bug.

issues.body:
### Is there an existing issue for the same bug?

- [x] I have checked the existing issues.

### RAGFlow workspace code commit ID

fe9e9a6

### RAGFlow image version

v0.16.0

### Other environment information

```Markdown
centos7.9
```

### Actual behavior


"$ cd ragflow
$ docker compose -f docker/docker-compose.yml up -d"
When you operate according to the following document, the ragflow-server will report an error :"Failed to resolve 'es01'"
You need to do this to avoid errors and successfully download the Elasticsearch image and deploy it :

$ cd ragflow/docker
$ docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d


Because the file 'ragflow/docker/docker-compose.yml' indicates "include:  - ./docker-compose-base.yml", this file contains the configuration for deploying Elasticsearch and this address is a relative path.
So if you deploy according to the document command, it will cause an error "Failed to resolve 'es01'", which is actually due to the fact that the service was not deployed before the error occurred.


### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Steps to reproduce

```Markdown
"$ cd ragflow
$ docker compose -f docker/docker-compose.yml up -d"
```
be careful! The above command is an incorrect operation

### Additional information

_No response_


----------------------------------
Actually, my problem was solved before it was raised, and there are my ideas and commands for solving it in the article.

> [@Nyx1197](https://github.com/Nyx1197) [@xiaohangguo](https://github.com/xiaohangguo) 看一下你们的镜像和docker容器运行情况。 使用docker images和docker ps -a 有尝试按照 $ cd ragflow/docker $ docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d 这样执行吗？

```
cd ragflow/docker
docker compose up
```

> > [@Nyx1197](https://github.com/Nyx1197) [@xiaohangguo](https://github.com/xiaohangguo) 看一下你们的镜像和docker容器运行情况。 使用docker images和docker ps -a 有尝试按照 $ cd ragflow/docker $ docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d 这样执行吗？

> 
> ```

docker compose up 等同于docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d

按照官网的操作， 
cd ragflow
docker compose -f docker/docker-compose.yml up -d
会导致es或infinity容器不启动。
必须如下操作
cd ragflow/docker
docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d

> 按照官网的操作， cd ragflow docker compose -f docker/docker-compose.yml up -d 会导致es或infinity容器不启动。 必须如下操作 cd ragflow/docker docker compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d

issues.title: [Question]: MAC OS (M3) ragflow The requested image's platform (linux/amd64) does not match the detected host platform (linux/arm64/v8) and no specific platform was requested
issues.body:
### Describe your problem

docker-compose up -d

ragflow The requested image's platform (linux/amd64) does not match the detected host platform (linux/arm64/v8) and no specific platform was requested

From https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow/blob/main/docs/guides/develop/build_docker_image.mdx

:::tip NOTE
While we also test RAGFlow on ARM64 platforms, we do not maintain RAGFlow Docker images for ARM. However, you can build an image yourself on a `linux/arm64` or `darwin/arm64` host machine.
:::

```bash
git clone https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow.git
cd ragflow/
pip3 install huggingface_hub nltk
python3 download_deps.py
docker build -f Dockerfile.deps -t infiniflow/ragflow_deps .
docker build -f Dockerfile -t infiniflow/ragflow:nightly .
docker build --build-arg LIGHTEN=1 -f Dockerfile -t infiniflow/ragflow:nightly-slim .
```

macmini m4 get error
latest: Pulling from infiniflow/ragflow_deps
no matching manifest for linux/arm64/v8 in the manifest list entries

@zuohaoda you need to build from scratch locally.
Just clone the project 
```
git clone https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow.git
cd ragflow/
```

Download dependencies
``` 
pip3 install huggingface_hub nltk
python3 download_deps.py
```

Remove any old "ragflow" images that you may have.

And build first image with dependencies
```
docker build -f Dockerfile.deps -t infiniflow/ragflow_deps .
```

After main ragflow image
```
docker build -f Dockerfile -t infiniflow/ragflow:nightly .
```

And only after that, you can use do 
```
docker compose -f docker/docker-compose-macos.yml up -d
```
To up the server with everything that is necessary.

> 
> To up the server with everything that is necessary.

> [@zuohaoda](https://github.com/zuohaoda) I have the same problem as you, there is no built-in model > > I solved this problem and modified the Dockerfile file: ``` # base stage FROM ubuntu:22.04 AS base USER root SHELL ["/bin/bash", "-c"] ARG NEED_MIRROR=0 ``` to `ARG NEED_MIRROR=1`

> > [@zuohaoda](https://github.com/zuohaoda) I have the same problem as you, there is no built-in model > > > > I solved this problem and modified the Dockerfile file: > > ``` > # base stage > FROM ubuntu:22.04 AS base > USER root > SHELL ["/bin/bash", "-c"] > > ARG NEED_MIRROR=0 > ``` > > to `ARG NEED_MIRROR=1` Thanks a lot, I modified this parameter and rebuilt the docker image, but the problem is still not solved

> > > 
> > > 
> > > macmini m4 get error latest: Pulling from infiniflow/ragflow_deps no matching manifest for linux/arm64/v8 in the manifest list entries
> > 
> > 
> > Have you taken care of it yet？
> 
> Yes, you can at least run without errors following the above steps

单纯执行docker pull --platform=linux/amd64 ubuntu:22.04 倒也可以。但是mac m1芯片是arm。而且dockerfile我也不确定如何修改

That works to me, thanks !

> > [@zuohaoda](https://github.com/zuohaoda) you need to build from scratch locally. Just clone the project
> > ```
> > git clone https://github.com/infiniflow/ragflow.git
> > cd ragflow/
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > Download dependencies
> > ```
> > pip3 install huggingface_hub nltk
> > python3 download_deps.py
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > Remove any old "ragflow" images that you may have.
> > And build first image with dependencies
> > ```
> > docker build -f Dockerfile.deps -t infiniflow/ragflow_deps .
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > After main ragflow image
> > ```
> > docker build -f Dockerfile -t infiniflow/ragflow:nightly .
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > And only after that, you can use do
> > ```
> > docker compose -f docker/docker-compose-macos.yml up -d
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > To up the server with everything that is necessary.
> 
> Thank you for your patient answer, I finally ran successfully after changing MySQL to mariadb.
> 
> Why is the rebuild image name `docker-ragflow:latest `and using `docker compose -f docker-docker-compose-macos.yml up -d` does not use` infiniflow-ragflow:nightly.` Where can I configure it? Very strange

comments_data.body: Upgrade the docker image to version `nightly` again.

> Upgrade the docker image to version `nightly` again.

@KevinHuSh It doesn't seem to be helping. I tried it, but the same issue occurred. The task executor is not starting; however, other services seem fine. It appears to be a bug specific to macOS 15.2+ on M4 devices. When I deployed it on my M1 Mac, everything worked perfectly.
me too

me too
m4 max

m4 macos 15.3

fixed the es cannot start problems, and now ragflow-server error.

What about building from source?
https://ragflow.io/docs/dev/build_docker_image
Refer to [this](https://github.com/baiyin/baiyin.github.io/blob/main/_posts/2024-12-27-Steps-to-Set-Up-RagFlow-on-macOS.md).

issues.title: Fixed #6234: Maintain consistent resolution logic when deleting datasets, documents, and parsing datasets.
issues.body:
The three APIs all follow the “best effort” principle and provide detailed error notifications.

### What problem does this PR solve?
Close #6234

### Type of change

- [x] Bug Fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

@liwenju0 
Thank you very much for your commits!
I tested your latest commit (69c64ea), and here are the results:

- ​**delete dataset**: Deletes the dataset and returns:

```json
{'code': 0, 'data': {'success_count': 1}}
```

- **delete document**: Deletes the document and returns:

```json
{'code': 102, 'message': 'Found duplicate IDs: 749c295803eb11f0939916efd1f46f32'}
```

- **parse document**: Initiates parsing and returns:

```json
{'code': 0, 'data': {'success_count': 1}}
```

**Expected Behavior:**

- code should be 0.
- data.success_count should count the number of successful operations.
- message or data.errors should list all duplicate or failed instance IDs.
- All valid IDs should complete their corresponding operations.

The current implementation does not meet the expected behavior.

            get_http_api_auth, dataset_id, {"document_ids": document_ids}
        )
        assert res["code"] == 102
